title: 'A moving moment' as Rosenior breaks barriers
summary: Liam Rosenior's appointment as Chelsea manager is a "massive moment" for representation in the Premier League.

title: Women's indoor golf league to launch in 2026
summary: The inaugural women's edition of the indoor league launched by Tiger Woods and Rory McIlroy will take place at the end of 2026.

title: Semenyo to Man City deal done pending medical
summary: Bournemouth winger Antoine Semenyo is set to have a medical after his side's game against Tottenham on Wednesday before he makes a move to Manchester City.

title: Fulham contact PGMOL over 'offside' Wirtz goal
summary: Marco Silva says Fulham have contacted the Professional Game Match Officials Limited over Florian Wirtz's controversial goal for Liverpool on Sunday.

title: 'Supply teacher' O'Neill insists Celtic need signings
summary: Returning interim manager Martin O'Neill is in no doubt that Celtic must strengthen this month - but how will that work?

title: Fletcher welcomes return of 'familiar face' Evans
summary: Manchester United interim manager Darren Fletcher says Jonny Evans' inclusion as a member of his backroom staff will see the return of a club stalwart who is familiar with the club and the players.

title: Man Utd hold talks with trio over caretaker role
summary: Manchester United hold talks with former players Darren Fletcher, Michael Carrick and Ole Gunnar Solskjaer about becoming the club's caretaker manager.

title: O'Neil agrees to become Strasbourg manager
summary: Gary O'Neil agrees to become Strasbourg's new manager after Liam Rosenior leaves the French club to join Chelsea.

title: 'It's a key moment that celebrates a young, black English manager'
summary: Kick It Out CEO Samuel Okafor and ex-Chelsea defender Paul Elliott, former chair of the FA's inclusion and diversity board, talk to BBC Sport about the importance of appointing Liam Rosenior as Chelsea manager.

title: Livingston v St Mirren & six cup ties postponed
summary: Tuesday's Scottish Premiership game between Livingston and St Mirren and five Challenge Cup ties are postponed.

title: Rosenior 'ready' for Chelsea job
summary: Speaking in his last press conference as Strasbourg manager, Liam Rosenior says taking the job at Chelsea is the right move for his career. The 41-year-old has spent the last 18-months at the Blues' sister club Strasbourg after he was sacked from Hull City in 2024.

title: Hamilton insolvency risk remains, admits new owner
summary: New Hamilton owner Rob Edwards admits the club is still at risk of being placed in administration but is confident insolvency can be avoided.

title: 'McQueen attributed dementia to heading ball'
summary: Former Scotland, Manchester United and Leeds United defender Gordon McQueen attributed his dementia to heading a ball, his daughter tells an inquest.

title: In Pictures: Sporting photos of the week
summary: A selection of some of the most striking sports photographs taken around the world over the past seven days.

title: West Ham in talks to terminate Wilson's contract
summary: West Ham are close to an agreement with striker Callum Wilson to terminate his contract at the club.

title: All your FPL stats and Premier League team news in one place
summary: Every key bit of Premier League team news and the most important Fantasy Premier League statistics - all in one place.

title: Amorim 'blow-up' brings Wilcox into the spotlight
summary: Who is Manchester United's director of football Jason Wilcox and how did he become one of the most powerful figures in football?

title: 'Who remembers Sir Alex Ferguson?' - Why Man Utd hire former players as interim managers
summary: Monday Night Clubโs Rory Smith and ex-Manchester United player Phil Jones discuss why the club appoint former players as interim managers, as Darren Fletcher takes on the role.

title: Aspinall set for surgery on 'nightmare' eye injury
summary: UFC heavyweight champion Tom Aspinall says he will have surgery on the "nightmare" eye injury he suffered against Ciryl Gane.

title: Australian Open offers record prize money - but stars still 'disappointed'
summary: The Australian Open will offer a record prize pot of ยฃ55m at this year's tournament - but players are still likely to be unhappy a source says.

title: Why Chelsea have turned to 'innovator' Rosenior
summary: After Chelsea give Liam Rosenior his first Premier League managerial job, BBC Sport looks at why they have appointed him.

title: Howe 'very happy' at Newcastle amid Man Utd link
summary: Head coach Eddie Howe says he is "very happy" at Newcastle United as he dismisses speculation linking with him the Manchester United job.

title: Kilmarnock 'have faith' McCann can keep them up
summary: Kilmarnock "have complete faith" new manager Neil McCann and assistant Billy Dodds can keep the Ayrshire club in the Scottish Premiership.

title: West Bromwich Albion sack head coach Mason
summary: Ryan Mason is sacked as head coach of West Bromwich Albion following Monday's Championship defeat by Leicester City.

title: Rashford may have route back to Man Utd - Tuesday's gossip
summary: Ruben Amorim sacking might offer Marcus Rashford way back to Manchester United, trio may stay at Old Trafford after head coach's exit, Juventus keen on Federico Chiesa return.

title: 'One of the greatest disgraces in modern European football' - Smith and Sutton on Rosenior appointment
summary: Monday Night Club's Chris Sutton and Rory Smith give their views on Liam Rosenior's appointment as Chelsea head coach and the consequences for Strasbourg, with Rory Smith describing Chelsea's use of their multi-club ownership model to "summon" Rosenior as "unfair."

title: 'Sydney is a city of endings - this felt like another'
summary: England's meek performance on day three of the fifth Ashes Test felt like the end of an era, says Stephan Shemilt.

title: Battle of the Sexes 'brought eyes on tennis'
summary: Women's world number one Aryna Sabalenka defends the 'Battle of the Sexes' match against Nick Kyrgios after opening her season with a crushing win in Brisbane.

title: Norrie wins and Kyrgios' return ends in defeat
summary: Nick Kyrgios' first ATP Tour match since March ends in a first-round defeat at the Brisbane International, as Britain's Cameron Norrie books his place in the second round with a hard-fought win.

title: Smith and Head score centuries as Australia punish England on day three
summary: Travis Head scores 163 and Steve Smith ends unbeaten on 129 as Australia close on 518-7 in their first innings, leading England by 134 runs at stumps on day three of the fifth and final Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: 'I hope he's here for a long time' - Smith shows he's not done yet
summary: Steve Smith thwarts England again during the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney to leave only the great Sir Don Bradman ahead in terms of Ashes runs scored.

title: 'He's like a gladiator' - Smith reaches century as Australia build lead
summary: Australia captain Steve Smith leads from the front as he scores his 13th career Ashes century on his home ground to help his team to 449-7 in their first innings, giving them a 65-run lead against England on day three of the fifth Test in Sydney.

title: From Aronimink to Zalatoris - an A-Z of golf in 2026
summary: It could be a struggle to match the tumultuous highs of last year but there is still plenty to look forward to in the coming 12 months, writes Iain Carter.

title: Boundaries, drops and no more reviews - England's morning to forget
summary: Expensive overs, dropped catches and lost reviews sees England have a morning session to forget against Australia on day three of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: Head finally out for 163 as Bethell gets first Ashes wicket
summary: England finally bring an end to Travis Head's innings as he's trapped lbw for 163 by Jacob Bethell as he picks up his first Ashes wicket, to leave Australia 288-4 in their first innings, trailing England by 96 runs on day three of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: 'He's way ahead of the rest' - Head hits another stunning Ashes innings
summary: Watch the best shots of Travis Head's first innings as the Australian batter hits 163 off 166 balls, his third score of 100 or higher in the series, to put his side in control of the fifth and final Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: 'What a miss!' - Jacks drops simple chance as Head survives
summary: Will Jacks drops a simple catch on the boundary as England miss the chance to remove Travis Head, who remains unbeaten on 121 on day three of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: Stop experiments and get manager who fits Man Utd DNA - Neville
summary: Gary Neville urges Manchester United to 'stop experimenting' and appoint a manager who fits the club's DNA after Ruben Amorim was sacked on Monday.

title: 'Nancy blunder evidence of Celtic's blurred vision'
summary: There is "no apparent big picture view at Celtic", argues BBC Sport Scotland's Tom English as Wilfried Nancy and Paul Tisdale exit the ailing champions.

title: 'Not physically ready' - Djokovic out of Adelaide
summary: Novak Djokovic withdraws from his planned Australian Open warm-up tournament as he is "not quite physically ready to compete".

title: Raiders, Browns & Cardinals sack head coaches on NFL's Black Monday
summary: Las Vegas Raiders head coach Pete Carroll, Cleveland Browns' Kevin Stefanski and the Arizona Cardinals' Jonathan Gannon are all sacked with the NFL's 'Black Monday' in full swing

title: Garrett's record-breaking sack tops NFL plays of the week
summary: Watch Cleveland Browns defensive end Myles Garrett break the NFL's all-time sack record in the best of the plays from the final week of the regular season.

summary: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on Tony McGuinness of Above and Beyond - and AI - with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

summary: The two-time world champion is aiming to take the title from Luke Humphries.

title: Sheffield United deny deliberately delaying Cusack inquest
summary: Sheffield United deny deliberately delaying the inquest into the death of their former women's team captain Maddy Cusack.

summary: BBC Sport takes an amble through Wilfried Nancy's short tenure as Celtic manager.

title: Tactics, transfers and turmoil - inside the fall of Amorim

title: Can you name every Man Utd boss since Ferguson?
summary: With Ruben Amorim leaving, we ask: Can you name every manager or head coach to lead Manchester United since Sir Alex Ferguson's retirement in 2013?

title: No deal in place for Fury comeback
summary: Tyson Fury says he will come out of retirement in 2026 but there is currently no date or venue in place for the heavyweight to make his comeback.

summary: After sacking Ruben Amorim, might Manchester United co-owners INEOS consider approaching former England manager Gareth Southgate with a view to steadying the ship?

summary: Ruben Amorim's acrimonious exit is the latest example of Manchester United's chaos and instability under Sir Jim Ratcliffe, says Phil McNulty.

title: Man Utd can't keep sacking managers - Bosnich
summary: Former Manchester United goalkeeper Mark Bosnich says the fans want clarity and to know what is going on behind the scenes after the club sacked head coach Ruben Amorim.

title: Feyi-Waboso sparkles, trash-talking Searle and Quirke conundrum - Prem talking points
summary: Immanuel Feyi-Waboso's fast feet light up the Rec despite Exeter's defeat, while Leicester fly-half Billy Searle riles Saracens' old guard

title: Root hits 160 but Head leads Australia's response on day two
summary: Joe Root hits 160 as England are bowled out for 384 in their first innings of the fifth Test with Australia closing day two 218 runs behind, as they finish on 166-2 at stumps, with Travis Head unbeaten on 91 in Sydney.

title: Rosenior as good a coach as I've ever worked with - Rooney
summary: With Liam Rosenior in talks to fill the vacant manager's role at Chelsea, Wayne Rooney speaks on his former Derby County colleague and explains why he thinks Rosenior deserves to manage in the Premier League.

title: 'He can bat in Australia!' - Root hits sublime 160 for England
summary: Watch the best shots of Joe Root's first innings as he scores an impressive 160 to help England to 384 all out against Australia on day two of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: Root receives standing ovation as sublime innings comes to an end
summary: Joe Root's excellent first innings comes to an end as he's caught and bowled by Michael Neser for 160, to leave England on 384-9 on day two of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: 'One of the worst dismissals I've seen' - Smith gifts wicket to Australia
summary: Jamie Smith gifts his wicket to Australia as he's caught for 46 off the bowling of part-time bowler Marnus Labuschagne, as England fall to 323-6 just before lunch on day two of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: 'Struggling Frank trapped in gilded cage at joyless Tottenham'
summary: Struggling head coach Thomas Frank is trapped in a gilded cage at joyless Tottenham Hotspur, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

summary: Australia have retained the Ashes, but who makes your combined team of the series?
